meanings.definition: Preserve (food) in a can or tin.
meanings.sent1: I tinned some fruits for our camping trip.
meanings.sent2: She always tinned vegetables for the winter.
meanings.sent3: The squirrels tinned nuts for the long winter ahead.
meanings.sent4: His memories were tinned in his mind, preserved for eternity.
meanings.sent5: The old recipe was tinned in the family cookbook, never to be forgotten.

meanings.sent1: The tinned roof shone in the sunlight.
meanings.sent2: She admired the tinned surface of the antique mirror.
meanings.sent3: The tinned walls reflected the moonlight, creating a magical glow.
meanings.sent4: His smile was as bright as a tinned star in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The tinned fence gleamed like silver in the morning dew.

meanings.definition: To give a silvery appearance to (something) by coating it with a thin layer of tin.
meanings.sent1: He tinned the copper pot to make it look new.
meanings.sent2: The artist tinned the sculpture to enhance its beauty.
meanings.sent3: The magician tinned the wand, making it shimmer with magic.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter tinned the room with joy.
meanings.sent5: The sun tinned the ocean, turning it into a sparkling mirror.
